question: 7 (a)
statement_html: Suppose that p is an odd prime and let a be a primitive root mod p. Then show that \(\displaystyle a^{(p-1)/2} \equiv -1 \mod{p}\).
statement_latex:
Suppose that \emph{p} is an odd prime and let \emph{a} be a primitive
root mod \emph{p}. Then show that
$\displaystyle a^{(p-1)/2} \equiv -1 \mod{p}$.
statement_raw: Suppose that ''p'' is an odd prime and let ''a'' be a primitive root mod ''p''. Then show that <math> \displaystyle a^{(p-1)/2} \equiv -1 \mod{p} </math>.
